result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Alan Bracht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Alan Bracht is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron Alan Bracht was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 6, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance to be refunded to payor.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Cathy Morelli or H.R.G.
-Treatment or counseling that the Agent deems appropriate.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Alan Bracht

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.             Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 Supv fees = $440.00. eif

DE's father called re: bond refund rec'd.  DE's father stated he only rec'd part of the bond money he posted.  Advised DE's father that $750 was applied to cover the DE's assessments, the remaining $500 was refunded to him & he will need to address that with the DE himself or write the judge a letter if he wants to have the judge reconsider the application of the bond money.  DE's father was advised that he would've signed an agreement when he posted bond stating that he may or may not get all or part of that money back. jaf
to Alan Bracht ck# 024844 sent this date. eif
Filed by Atty Larimore. Re: Sentencing Hearing of Def. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO, Jail & E: Probation. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson .ADA:  Matthew L Hartung with student intern Ryan Moertel.  DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Aaron Alan Bracht appeared. Case called at 8:17. Includes 15CM64, 15CM191.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CM191. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM191. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1,3 in 15CM191 and 15CM64. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: I/S  4 months St. Croix County jail, huber granted for work.
1 year probation with conditions:
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cathy M. and H.R.G.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- AODA and any follow through recommended by the agent. 
- Treatment or counseling that the agent seems appropriate.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- $750.00  
   apply bond on file. Refund balance to payor.
DE to report to probation today, then bond will be discharged.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: K. Gehler DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore by phone. DF: Aaron Alan Bracht appeared. Case called at 2:42. Includes 15CM64, 15CM191. 15CM191 is currently a Branch 4 file. ADA Gehler updates the court and requests a trial date for 15CM64. Cut off for negotiations will be July 2, 2015. Bond continues. Address confirmed.  Jury trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on May 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Bond on file.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kathy M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: CAR for Branch 4, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler, Aaron Alan Bracht pro se. Atty Larimore represent him on another matter and will represent this case as well. Court questions Defendant.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
